headline: Your favorite candy just got pricier, and it’s not because of tariffs
summary: A global cocoa shortage is pushing Hershey to raise prices across its portfolio—and it’s not just about inflation.

raw.headline: Your favorite candy just got pricier, and it’s not because of tariffs
raw.summary: A global cocoa shortage is pushing Hershey to raise prices across its portfolio—and it’s not just about inflation.

headline: Hershey and other chocolate makers hike prices as cocoa remains near record highs
summary: Here’s the good news: The Hershey Co. says it’s not raising prices for Halloween candy this year.  Hershey, the maker of Reese’s, Whoppers, barkThins and other chocolate candies, said Wednesday that it will be raising U.S. retail prices later this fall.  In some cases, pack sizes will get smaller; in others, list prices will rise.

raw.headline: Hershey and other chocolate makers hike prices as cocoa remains near record highs

In some cases, pack sizes will get smaller; in others, list prices will rise.

headline: Hershey (HSY) Announces Kirk Tanner As New CEO
summary: The announcement of Kirk Tanner as the new CEO of Hershey (HSY) could have influenced the company's recent stock price move of 12% over the last week. Tanner, who brings extensive experience from PepsiCo, is expected to lead the company into the next phase of growth. The broader market, reflected by the S&P 500, reached new highs due to optimism surrounding a U.S.-Japan trade deal and strong corporate earnings, which likely played a role in Hershey's share price increase. The company's ascent...

headline: Hershey to raise candy prices by double digits amid elevated cocoa costs

headline: US court dismisses child-labour claims against cocoa importers
summary: The appeals court found there was no link between the plaintiffs' forced labour and the importers.

headline: Wendy’s replaces outgoing US president
summary: Pete Suerken, CEO and president of Wendy’s independent purchasing cooperative, will succeed long-time executive Abigail Pringle on Aug. 15.

headline: Wall Street Breakfast Podcast: Detroit 3 Cry Foul On Japan Tariff Deal
summary: Detroit Three automakers criticize U.S.-Japan trade deal over uneven tariffs. Cocoa prices drive another price hike at Hershey. Clorox sues Cognizant for 2023 cyberattack.
